title: Top takeaways from the first 13 games of the Stanley Cup playoffs
content: What have we learned from the beginning of Round 1? And what does it mean for the rest of the postseason?

title: Saints hope to have 'clarity' on Carr's injury soon
content: Saints general manager Mickey Loomis confirmed Wednesday that Derek Carr has an issue with his shoulder and said the team is hoping for more clarity in the future.

title: Mahomes: Chiefs ready to unleash passing attack
content: Patrick Mahomes is hopeful that a healthy Chiefs team can have the big-play passing game in 2025 that it lacked last season.

title: Fredette, BYU great to 2024 Olympian, retires
content: Jimmer Fredette, a star at BYU who went on to become an NBA lottery pick and then played for the U.S. in 3x3 basketball at last year's Paris Olympics, announced his retirement Wednesday.

title: Notre Dame's Carr, Minchey to vie for top QB
content: With Steve Angeli having entered the transfer portal, Notre Dame's QB competition is down to CJ Carr and Kenny Minchey.

title: Bueckers 'excited' to be part of Wings' new era
content: No. 1 draft pick Paige Bueckers said she is "super excited" for her future with a Dallas Wings organization that has a new general manager and head coach.

title: Run at history: Kipyegon eyes historic sub-4 mile
content: Three-time Olympic gold medalist Faith Kipyegon will attempt to become the first woman to break the four-minute mile.

title: Lakers, sparked by Redick ripping, tie up series
content: The Lakers were motivated by a JJ Redick tirade after their lead slipped in the third quarter, closing out a 94-85 win over the Timberwolves to even their first-round series.

title: Schrager's NFL mock draft: 32 predictions based on sources in the league
content: Peter Schrager's debut piece for ESPN is a Round 1 mock draft based on what he's hearing from his sources around the NFL.

title: Why Nico Iamaleava soured on Tennessee and ended up at UCLA
content: What really went down in Nico Iamaleava's split with Tennessee and move to UCLA? We go inside the drama months in the making.

title: The rapid rise of Amen and Ausar Thompson: From lottery picks to the playoffs in two seasons
content: The twins, who were drafted No. 4 and No. 5 in 2023, have been a major part of the Rockets' and Pistons' playoff berths.

content: Who are the best players in the class? Which teams need a QB? Here's our one-stop guide to the draft.

title: Our annual NFL Nation mock draft: All 32 team reporters make their picks for Round 1
content: The Titans filled their biggest need at quarterback with the No. 1 pick, but which team was next to take a QB?

title: Arsenal Keep or Dump: What must Arteta change this summer in order to win league?
content: As we approach the end of the season, it's time for big clubs to make big decisions. Let's begin with Arsenal: What should the Gunners do with their squad this offseason?

title: Replacing De Bruyne: How Man City could rebuild their midfield
content: The way forward for Pep Guardiola will be to find multi-purpose midfielders with the quality to fill several positions.

title: One ring away: Players who could cement legacies with a title
content: These six stars -- featuring one MVP and one likely one -- need deep playoff runs to secure their places in history.

title: Brett Favre, Deion Sanders and more NFL draft fashion history
content: NFL draftees love to strut their stuff on the night they're selected. Here's a look back at some of their incredible fits.

title: 'Once-in-a-lifetime experience:' How the NFL's smallest market is coming up big to host the draft
content: The Lambeau countdown clock to the draft is running out of days, and the NFL's smallest town is ready.

title: From Lauren Betts to Olivia Miles: Ranking the top 15 prospects for the 2026 WNBA draft
content: Center Lauren Betts starts out as the front-runner to be the No. 1 pick in the 2026 WNBA draft class.

title: Arena: Poch doesn't understand culture of USMNT
content: Former USMNT coach Bruce Arena has criticized the appointment of current head coach Mauricio Pochettino, saying that a non-American lacks the necessary understanding of the country's culture.

title: Wrexham a 'circus,' says rival boss before clash
content: Wrexham have been described as a "circus" by Charlton Athletic manager Nathan Jones ahead of Saturday's showdown between the promotion-hunting League One sides.

title: Source: Rashford eyes Champions League club
content: Marcus Rashford is open to returning to Manchester United he does not believe he has the chance of first-team football while Ruben Amorim remains, a source told ESPN.

title: Lauren, Jrue Holiday invest in NWSL's Courage
content: Lauren and Jrue Holiday were announced as the newest investors of the North Carolina Courage through their Holiday Family Trust.

title: Abramovich to break silence on Chelsea sale
content: Former Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich has spoken for the first time about his sale of the club in a book that will be released this summer.

title: BoSox's Cora: Soccer schedule tougher than MLB
content: Boston Red Sox manager Alex Cora said didn't become a soccer fan until a visit to Anfield in 2019 for Liverpool-Manchester City, but since that moment has full admiration for just how much the overloaded soccer schedule compares to the MLB season.

title: Yamal: 'Incredible' to inspire kids as Messi did
content: Barcelona forward Lamine Yamal said it's amazing to have young fans looking up to him in the same way he once sought inspiration from Lionel Messi.

title: Ex-Brazil coach Tite taking mental health break
content: Former Brazil coach Tite said he is taking an indefinite career break in order to take care of his mental and physical health.

title: Ranking the top 25 men's basketball teams after the transfer portal close
content: A new team at the top. Another that climbs 12 spots. And more teams moving up or down in our latest forecast.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Time to rethink your Coors Field strategy
content: Start Colorado Rockies' bats at home and avoid visiting pitchers? That old standby strategy may be no more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Bruno, Wharton for midfield revamp
content: Manchester United want Newcastle's Bruno Guimarães and Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton to strengthen in midfield. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Khalistani Terrorist, On The Run Since 1995, Arrested From Punjab
content: A member of a Khalistani group, who was on the run for the past three decades, was arrested from a village in Punjab's Amritsar on Wednesday, officials said here.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: 25 Indians, 1 Nepal Citizen Killed; India Acts Tough Against Pakistan
content: Pahalgam terror attack live updates: In a sharp response to the terrorist attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam, India on Wednesday announced a series of tough measures against Pakistan.

title: Over 90% Of Terrorists Active In J&K Are From Pak: Officials
content: Jammu and Kashmir, which witnessed the massacre of 26 tourists in Pahalgam on Tuesday afternoon, has seen an increase in infiltration through the International Border, with 40-50 attempts being made in the past 6-8 months alone, officials have said.

title: J&K MLA Sajad Lone Says "All Of Kashmir Shedding Tears Of Blood"
content: People's Conference chief Sajad Lone on Wednesday led the party's candlelight vigil against the Pahalgam terror attack and said that all of Kashmir was "shedding tears of blood".

title: Indus Waters Ex-Commissioner On India's Options After Treaty Suspension
content: India on Wednesday announced that the Indus Waters Treaty of 1960 with Pakistan will be held in abeyance with immediate effect, until Islamabad credibly and irrevocably abjures its support for cross-border terrorism.

title: "Understand Why People Want To Leave": Omar Abdullah On Exodus Of Tourists  After Pahalgam Attack
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah today called the exodus of tourists from Kashmir after the Pahalgam terror attack "heartbreaking". The tourists have been leaving Jammu and Kashmir in droves since yesterday's attack in which 26 people d

title: Mossad Uncovered Web Of People Who Targeted Adani And India: Fact-Checker On Hindenburg
content: The US-based short seller Hindenburg Research which shut down weeks after Joe Biden lost the presidential election this January faced a determined counterattack from Adani Group, which the short seller had targeted in January 2023.

title: Air Force Corporal Killed In Pahalgam Terror Attack Was Days Away From Transfer
content: Indian Air Force corporal Tage Hailyang -- gunned down by terrorists at Pahalgam's Baisaran Valley -- was just days away from getting transferred out of Kashmir.

title: Navy Officer Killed In Pahalgam Attack Cremated With Full Military Honours In Karnal
content: Last respects were paid to Lieutenant Vinay Narwal on Wednesday, including a formal procession and a rifle salute, following which a cremation ceremony took place with full military honours at the late soldier's native hometown in Karnal.

title: India Suspends Indus Waters Treaty, Shuts Attari Border In Strong Response To Pakistan
content: The Cabinet Committee on Security - India's top-decision making body on national security has implemented some punishing measures against Pakistan over the "cross-border linkages" that surfaced in the investigation over the terror attack in Kashmir.

title: What Is Indus Waters Treaty With Pak That India Suspended After J&K Terror Attack
content: In a sharp response to the terrorist attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam, India on Wednesday announced a series of measures against Pakistan, including the suspension of the Indus-Waters Treaty that governs the sharing of the river Indus' waters.

title: Cross Border Links To Pahalgam Attack: India Downgrades Ties With Pakistan
content: India on Wednesday downgraded diplomatic ties with Pakistan and announced a raft of measures including expulsion of Pakistani military attaches, suspension of the over six-decade-old Indus Water Treaty and immediate shutting down of the Attari border

title: US Will "Walk Away" Unless Russia, Ukraine Agree On Peace Deal: JD Vance
content: Vice President JD Vance warned Wednesday that the United States would "walk away" unless Russia and Ukraine agree a peace deal, as envoys from Washington, Kyiv and European nations gathered for downgraded talks in Britain.

title: Supreme Court Invokes Article 142 To Protect 250 Students' Career
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday invoked Article 142 of the Constitution to protect 250 students from facing hurdles in education due to the shifting of their institute's campus.

title: 51 Aftershocks Follow Powerful 6.2 Magnitude Earthquake In Istanbul
content: More than 50 aftershocks rocked the Istanbul region after a powerful 6.2 magnitude earthquake struck the Sea of Marmara just to the south of Turkey's biggest city on Wednesday, the interior minister said.

title: IMF, World Bank "Must Be Made Fit For Purpose Again": US Treasury Chief
content: The International Monetary Fund and World Bank "must be made fit for purpose again," US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Wednesday, arguing the institutions have strayed from their initial missions.

title: "Get In On The Action": Meta To Launch Ray-Ban Glasses In India Soon
content: Social media giant Meta will launch its artificial intelligence enabled Ray-Ban Meta Glasses in India soon, the company said in a blog post on Wednesday.

title: "Growing Trend Of Dowry Victim Arraigning Husband's Relative": Supreme Court
content: There is growing trend of the dowry victim arraigning the relatives of the husband, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said and quashed a dowry harassment case against a woman's parents-in-law.

title: "Leave In 48 Hours," India Tells Pakistanis On SAARC Visa
content: Announcing a series of big steps a day after the terrorist attack in Pahalgam in which 26 people were killed, the Centre said on Wednesday that Pakistani nationals will not be allowed to travel to India under the SAARC Visa Exemption Scheme.

title: How Knowing Islamic Verse May Have Saved Hindu Man's Life In J&K Attack
content: Knowing the 'kalima' (an Islamic declaration of faith) probably led to a professor from Assam narrowly escaping with his life during the terror attack in Pahalgam, in which 26 people were killed.

title: Water, trade & visa: India moves to cripple Pakistan after Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan. Integrated checkpost Attari will be closed. Pakistani nationals are barred from SAARC visa exemptions. Defence advisors in the Pakistani high commission are declared persona non grata. India will withdraw its advisors from Islamabad. The government has directed forces to maintain high vigil.

title: Indus water treaty: What is it & how will its suspension impact Pak?
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India has suspended the Indus Water Treaty with Pakistan, a decision made during a high-level security meeting. This treaty, brokered by the World Bank in 1960, governs the sharing of the Indus River system. The suspension poses significant challenges for Pakistan's agriculture and water security, potentially leading to economic instability.

title: IPL: Boult's four-fer cripples Hyderabad; Rohit leads Mumbai to victory
content: Trent Boult's devastating spell dismantled Sunrisers Hyderabad's batting lineup, while Rohit Sharma's composed innings guided Mumbai Indians to a comfortable seven-wicket victory. Boult's early strikes and Sharma's anchoring knock propelled MI back into the top four, leaving SRH struggling to stay afloat in the IPL 2025 standings. Suryakumar Yadav's explosive finish sealed the win for Mumbai.

title: 133 students, including Indians, get their SEVIS records restored in US
content: The US government has reinstated the SEVIS records of 133 students, many of whom are Indian, following a court order. This allows them to continue their studies or OPT programs. While some students' visas were revoked, lawyers argue that SEVIS termination, which the government downplays, significantly impacts a student's legal status, contradicting official guidance.

title: Results of paternity test of Ashley Clair's son out: How the lab results...
content: Elon Musk has been confirmed as the father of Ashley Clair's son, Romulus, following a paternity test. Clair publicly announced the child's birth in February 2025, explaining her initial desire for privacy. However, a dispute has arisen over child support, with Clair claiming a reduction in payments and Musk denying any financial retaliation, despite providing millions in support.

title: Why Trump seems 'desperate for a deal' with Xi Jinping
content: Donald Trump seems to be softening his stance on the trade war with China. He hints at lowering tariffs, but Beijing isn't responding. China is showing resistance and preparing to operate independently. Experts suggest Trump's shift reflects domestic pressures. The situation is described as an economic war. A summit between Trump and Xi Jinping appears unlikely due to distrust.

title: Attari border closed: How it will impact trade with Pakistan
content: Following the tragic terrorist attack in Pahalgam, India has closed the Attari Integrated Check Post, a key trade route with Pakistan. Foreign Secretary Misri announced the closure, allowing only returnees until May 1, 2025. The move, impacting trade worth Rs 3,886.

title: 'Buying trouble is ...': Internet reacts to bizarre Ishan Kishan dismissal
content: Ishan Kishan's controversial dismissal, marked by an umpire's questionable decision and Kishan's premature walk, ignited social media during the Sunrisers Hyderabad-Mumbai Indians IPL match. Despite a strong recovery led by Heinrich Klaasen and Abhinav Manohar, Hyderabad posted 143 for eight after an early collapse triggered by Trent Boult and Deepak Chahar.

title: Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan CEO & others sold billions in stock before Trump Tariffs
content: Before President Trump's tariff announcement triggered a market crash, Meta's Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan Chase's Jamie Dimon, and Oracle's Safra Catz sold significant amounts of stock. These sales, totaling billions, occurred just before the market downturn, raising questions about potential insider knowledge. While the market plummeted, some billionaires saw it as a buying opportunity.

title: Airlines, airports unite to bring Pahalgam victim's body, family home to Surat
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, two private airlines, Air India Express, and Surat Airport collaborated to ensure the victim's family and mortal remains reached their Surat home promptly. Air India Express delayed its Delhi-Surat flight after Surat Airport extended its operating hours. This coordinated effort involved DIAL, security teams, ground handlers, and the Airports Authority of India, facilitating a dignified and timely passage for the grieving family.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: All-party meeting likely to be held tomorrow
content: A terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam has claimed at least 28 lives, prompting swift action from the Indian government. PM Modi convened a high-level meeting, while Finance Minister Sitharaman cut short her US trip. Political leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, have engaged with officials and expressed solidarity.

title: Peace, profit or Putin? What's behind Trump's Russia-friendly policy
content: Under Trump's presidency, a shift in US policy towards the Russia-Ukraine war is evident. The US has twice voted with Russia in UN resolutions, contrasting with previous support for Ukraine. Trump's administration has also excluded Russia from new tariffs and expressed interest in improved relations, citing potential economic deals and geopolitical stability, raising questions about motives.

title: Microsoft’s chief HR to managers: This isn't just about Microsoft's success...
content: Microsoft is implementing stricter performance management policies, including a two-year rehire ban for underperformers and restrictions on internal transfers. These changes aim to accelerate high performance and swiftly address low performance, aligning with industry trends toward performance-based evaluations. The company is also introducing AI-supported tools to aid managers in performance conversations.

title: J&K encounter: Big gunfight in Kulgam, security forces trap terrorists
content: Security forces and terrorists engaged in an encounter in Kulgam's Tangmarg area. This followed a deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran Valley, which killed 28 people, including tourists and an Indian Navy officer. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh assured a strong response. Sketches of three Pakistani suspects, Asif Fauji, Suleman Shah, and Abu Talha, were released.

title: Does Vladimir Putin have a secret son? All about Ivan Vladimirovich Putin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is facing renewed scrutiny with reports surfacing about a 'secret son,' Ivan Vladimirovich Putin, allegedly born in 2015 to Alina Kabaeva. The ten-year-old is reportedly kept hidden, living in a high-security palace and largely isolated. While Putin has two acknowledged daughters, claims suggest he has two sons with Kabaeva and another daughter with Svetlana Krivonogikh.

title: Bumrah hits 300! Where does it rank among T20 wicket-takers?
content: Jasprit Bumrah achieved a significant milestone, claiming his 300th T20 wicket during Mumbai Indians' IPL match against Sunrisers Hyderabad. He dismissed Heinrich Klaasen to reach the landmark, while Trent Boult starred with a four-wicket haul. The match was played with both teams wearing black armbands to pay respect to the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Pakistan cricketer's two words message on Pahalgam attack
content: Mohammad Hafeez expressed grief over the Pahalgam terrorist attack, which resulted in the deaths of at least 28 civilians and left over 20 injured, marking it as one of the deadliest incidents since the 2019 Pulwama bombing. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah have strongly condemned the attack. Shah, in particular, delivered a powerful statement asserting the nation's unwavering resolve against terrorism.

title: Wild 10 seconds in IPL! Umpire confused, Snickometer says NOT OUT
content: Mumbai Indians skipper Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Mumbai Indians have brought in Vignesh Puthur in place of Ashwani Kumar, while home team skipper Pat Cummins too made one change to his playing XI by bringing in Jaydev Unadkat in place of Mohammed Shami, who is among their impact substitutes.

title: Gold prices hit Rs 1 lakh! Should you buy or sell? Explained
content: Gold prices have breached the Rs 1 lakh mark and investors are wondering - is this the right time to buy gold or should they be booking profits? What's the gold rate outlook for this year and will the rally last? Experts weigh in:

title: Why many high-end luxury items are set to become costlier
content: Luxury goods exceeding Rs 10 lakh, including handbags, watches, art, and yachts, will now incur a 1% tax collected at source (TCS), effective from April 22. This measure, introduced in the Finance Act 2024, aims to enhance the income tax department's ability to track high-value purchases by mandating PAN details.

title: Pahalgam attack: Rajnath Singh vows 'loud & clear' response soon
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has promised a firm response to the Pahalgam terror attack. Twenty-six people, mostly tourists, died in the attack. The government will hunt down the perpetrators and those behind the attack. A high-level meeting was held with top military officials. Additional troops are being deployed for search operations.

title: IPL 2025: Why SRH, MI players are wearing black armbands
content: Mumbai Indians and Sunrisers Hyderabad honored victims of the Pahalgam terrorist attack with a minute's silence and black armbands during their IPL 2025 match. SRH, struggling with inconsistent performances and in need of a win to revive their season, faced a confident MI team riding a three-game winning streak.

title: Hardik Pandya, Pat Cummins mourn Pahalgam tragedy
content: Before their IPL 2025 match in Hyderabad, Sunrisers Hyderabad captain Pat Cummins and Mumbai Indians skipper Hardik Pandya conveyed their condolences to the families affected by the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir. Pandya, after winning the toss and choosing to field, condemned the attack. Addressing the Pahalgam tragedy, Cummins said: "(On the Pahalgam terror attack) It has been heartbreaking for us as well, our thoughts are with the victims and their families."

title: Amir exposes PCB, reveals why he really quit Pakistan cricket… again
content: Mohammad Amir revealed feeling sidelined by the Pakistan cricket setup after the 2024 T20 World Cup due to a lack of communication regarding future plans, leading to his retirement. He also mentioned turning down a County contract to represent Pakistan and advocated for aggressive mindset in cricket. Amir expressed support for Babar Azam's comeback.

title: 'He fell with blood flowing from his head': Wife of accountant killed in Pahalgam
content: Odisha native Prasant Kumar Satpathy tragically died in a terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu & Kashmir, while vacationing with his family. The 41-year-old was fatally shot, as confirmed by his wife Priyadarshini, who was also present during the attack. Another Odisha resident, Shashi Kumari, sustained injuries and is receiving treatment.

title: Watch: Wife of slain Navy officer clings to coffin in tearful farewell
content: The nation mourns the loss of 28 lives in a terror attack in Pahalgam, including navy lieutenant Vinay Narwal, whose recent marriage adds to the tragedy. Emotional farewells were held at Delhi's IGI Airport, with his wife inconsolably grieving. Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi and Delhi CM Rekha Gupta paid respects, while Narwal's remains were taken to his family in Karnal, Haryana.

title: Former Pakistan coach's pay dispute heats up; PCB issues strong statement
content: Pakistan Cricket Board clarifies that Jason Gillespie has received all payments. This follows media reports of alleged unpaid dues. Gillespie reportedly claimed the PCB owes him bonuses. The PCB source states Gillespie did not give the required notice period. Aaqib Javed is now the interim head coach for both formats after Gillespie's and Kirsten's resignations.

title: Vadra links Pahalgam attack to govt's Hindutva push; BJP hits back
content: Robert Vadra sparked controversy by linking the Pahalgam terror attack to the BJP's Hindutva policies, alleging it fueled a divide between Hindus and Muslims, weakening minorities. The BJP swiftly condemned Vadra, accusing him of shielding terrorists and blaming India for the atrocities committed by Pakistani terrorists.

title: 'Condemning ghastly, cowardly act in Pahalgam': BCCI Secretary
content: The BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia condemned the Pahalgam terror attack, which resulted in the tragic loss of 26 lives and left many injured. Expressing deep shock and anguish, the BCCI extended heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families and offered prayers for the departed souls. The board stands in solidarity with the victims, sharing their pain during this difficult time.

title: Inside Pahalgam plot: Terrorists used code names Moosa, Yunus and Asif
content: Security agencies have identified the three terrorists behind the deadly Pahalgam attack as Asif Fauji, Suleman Shah, and Abu Talha, believed to be TRF operatives using code names Moosa, Yunus, and Asif. Sketches of the suspects, based on survivor accounts, have been released as a search operation intensifies. According to officials, the trio was previously active in Poonch and had a history of orchestrating terror strikes in the region.

title: World Bank cuts India’s FY26 growth forecast to 6.3% citing global headwinds
content: The World Bank has lowered India's GDP growth forecast for FY 2025-26 to 6.3%, citing global economic headwinds and domestic policy uncertainties. The IMF also revised its projection downward to 6.2%. Across South Asia, growth projections have been broadly reduced, with the region expected to grow at 5.8% in 2025.

title: Faces of terror: Probing agencies release photo of four Pahalgam terrorists
content: Security agencies have released photographs of suspected terrorists involved in the deadly Pahalgam attack in Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in 28 fatalities. The identified terrorists, using code names, are Asif Fauji, Suleman Shah, and Abu Talha. Simultaneously, security forces foiled an infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Baramulla, engaging infiltrators in a firefight.

title: Who is Austin Reaves’ girlfriend Jenna Barber?
content: Los Angeles Lakers' Austin Reaves' romance with high school sweetheart Jenna Barber is capturing attention. Since 2014, their bond has grown, evident in social media posts showcasing vacations and golf outings. Barber's support for Reaves' career is unwavering, often seen cheering him on at Lakers games. Recent viral beach photos of the couple have delighted fans, celebrating their relationship.

title: Good news! This state slashes EV road tax to just 1% till March ‘26: Details
content: Gujarat is incentivizing electric vehicle adoption with a 5% tax exemption, effectively reducing the tax to 1% until March 2026. Announced by Minister Harsh Sanghavi, this initiative aims to promote eco-friendly mobility and ease the financial burden on EV buyers. Citizens can avail the benefit through the Vahan 4.0 portal.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Pakistan condoles death of tourists
content: Following the deadly terror attack near Pahalgam that killed 28 tourists, Pakistan extended condolences while simultaneously denying any involvement. Pakistan's foreign office expressed concern and offered sympathies, while its defense minister dismissed any link to Islamabad, attributing the violence to internal discontent within India. The attack, which occurred in the Baisaran meadow near Pahalgam, is the deadliest in the Valley since the Pulwama bombing of 2019.

title: Families of victims of terror attack break down, plead in front of Amit Shah - Video
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed at least 28, Union Home Minister Amit Shah met with victims' families in Srinagar, assuring them justice. Security forces will leave no stone unturned to find the perpetrators. Prime Minister Modi, cutting short his Saudi Arabia visit, convened an urgent briefing.

title: ‘India a hot market but...’: Tesla says 100% car tariffs make customers anxious
content: Elon Musk-led Tesla views India as a promising market but is concerned about the 100% tariffs on imported automobiles, which create customer anxiety. Despite securing showroom locations and advertising job positions, the company is carefully evaluating the timing of its entry.

title: Gold at record high! Sovereign gold bond investors eye 221% returns
content: With gold prices soaring to a record ₹1 lakh per 10 grams, Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) investors are contemplating selling. Those who invested in 2017 are seeing returns of 221%. Financial experts advise maintaining 10-15% of portfolios in gold for stability.

title: Bitcoin beats Amazon in market value; becomes world’s 6th most valuable asset
content: Bitcoin's market capitalisation has surged past Amazon, reaching $1.857 trillion and becoming the sixth-largest asset globally. This rally, fueled by increased institutional investment and spot ETF inflows, has propelled Bitcoin to $93,546.

title: Tariffs 'hurt multilateral trade and world economic order,' says China
content: President Xi Jinping has criticized tariffs. He said that tariffs undermine the global economic order. This statement comes amid tensions between China and the United States. Earlier, Donald Trump imposed tariffs on Chinese imports. China retaliated with duties on American goods. China opposes deals at its expense. Foreign Minister Wang Yi urged the UK and EU to defend multilateral trade.

title: Mohammed Siraj wants terrorists to be punished without mercy
content: Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj has condemned the recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in the tragic loss of at least 28 lives. In an emotional message on Instagram, Siraj expressed his outrage at the senseless violence against innocent civilians, emphasizing that no ideology can justify such brutality.

title: 'I tried it. I'm like, dude, it doesn't work': Pitchers tell their best stories of failed new pitches
content: Detroit Tigers left-hander Tarik Skubal throws a good slider . it's not the slider he wants, according to the reigning American League Cy Young Award winner . the slider belongs to Clayton Kershaw, the future Hall of Famer .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Game 3 of Avs-Stars, while Canadiens, Oilers seek revenge
content: game 1 of the series went to overtime, as did game 2 of the Dallas Stars - Colorado Avalanche battle . in the nightcap, the Los Angeles Kings won with a goal in the final minute . what are the key storylines heading into the games? Read on for game previews with statistical insights .

title: Mitchell latest to join loaded St. John's via portal
content: sources tell ESPN that dillon Mitchell has committed to the Red Storm . Mitchell was a top-five recruit and McDonald's All American coming out of high school in 2022 . he averaged 9.9 points and 6.9 rebounds for the Bearcats last season .

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Hurricanes new favorites following Avalanche Game 2 loss
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs have begun with 16 teams looking to be the last one standing after four rounds of playoff hockey action . the Florida Panthers return to defend their championship, but will have to contend with regular-season powerhouses including the Winnipeg Jets , Washington Capitals and Edmonton Oilers . they have emerged as the Eastern Conference favorites thanks to a 2-0 series lead over the banged-up New Jersey Devils .

title: NBA playoff odds: Lakers solidify top-5 championship odds after Game 2 win
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds . they have traded series-favorite status with their Game 1 and Game 2 wins .

title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.2 jolts Turkey's Istanbul
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Himachal decides to ban use of PET bottles in govt. meetings, hotels with effect from June 1
content: The State government has also imposed a ban on the use of certain non-biodegradable materials under the above mentioned Act to prevent pollution, save and protect the environment

title: A story of survival acquires dramatic dimensions
content: Chevittorma focusses on the resilience of families on a narrow strip of land hemmed in by the backwaters and the sea on the western fringes of Ernakulam district

title: Two decades on, proposal to widen Seaport-Airport Road still on paper
content: The State government is yet to approve a ₹40-crore proposal submitted by the Public Works department in 2022 to expand the stretch; project to decongest Collectorate Junction in the corridor also awaits nod

title: Jharkhand youth arrested for backing Pahalgam terrorists in social media post
content: The accused wrote on X in Urdu ‘Thank you Pakistan, thank you Lashkar-e-Taiba; an FIR has been lodged against the accused under various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita

title: Sithalapakkam residents complain of sewage being let out on vast, open land
content: Residents irked by foul stench, say they are unable to use bore wells. Sithalapakkam panchayat president claims he has warned those who were dumping the sewage

title: Pahalgam terror attack: VHP demands action against Pakistan
content: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad and its youth wing, Bajrang Dal, announced that they would hold a nationwide protest on Friday against the terror attack

title: School-based dance routines reduce the risk of non-communicable diseases among girls, study finds
content: According to the study, a 10-minute, high-intensity dance routine during school hours reduced body fat and blood pressure in adolescent girls within 12 weeks, highlighting the effectiveness of school-based health interventions

title: Macron, Putin, Trump lead global condolences after terror strike in Pahalgam
content: Messages also came in from the travelling U.S. Vice President J.D. Vance, Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the Chief Adviser of the interim government of Bangladesh Prof. Mohammed Yunus

title: Hundreds join pony driver’s last rites, co-workers recall his attempt to stop one of the attackers in Pahalgam
content: According to local pony drivers, one of the attackers came close to the victim as Shah ‘made a bid to stop him from firing at tourists’; the victim’s father said his son was the main breadwinner for the family

title: Two-day training by EC of booth levels officers in Bihar
content: The training programme was inaugurated by Chief Election Commissioner of India Gyanesh Kumar in the presence of Election Commissioner Dr. Vivek Joshi at the India International Institute of Democracy and Election Management

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Amit Shah meets victims’ families, says ‘Bharat will not bend to terror’
content: Shah, who reached Srinagar on April 22, 2025, assured the survivors of the attack that the perpetrators of the dastardly act would be brought to justice, officials said

title: Akhilesh accuses BJP of politicising Pahalgam attack
content: The SP president is believed to be hinting at a reported poster by BJP Chhattisgarh unit reading “Dharm poocha, jati nahi.....yaad rakhenge” (they asked about religion not caste, will remember)

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Hotels asked to forgo cancellation fees for J&K
content: Stakeholders in the tourism industry said that the attack would have a deep impact on domestic tourism and affect the livelihood of many in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Swiss visa rejection led newly-wed Naval officer to a nightmare honeymoon in Pahalgam
content: The couple planned to honeymoon in Switzerland, but changed plans after visa denial, says family; “Pakistan should be taught a lesson... should be ruined,” says relative

title: Karnataka Transport Department clarifies on panic buttons, VLTDs malfunction claims
content: This move follows a spate of complaints and viral social media videos in which cab drivers alleged that the VLTDs in their vehicles were not operational and, more critically, not linked to the department’s Command and Control Centre located in Shanthinagar.

title: India to work with Saudi Arabia to enhance stability of global oil markets
content: India and Saudi Arabia collaborate on oil markets, energy dynamics, climate change, technology, tourism, and Yemen crisis in joint statement.

title: Corporation to use reform incentive for property tax mapping and drainage work
content: Civic body chosen for reform incentive last year for its effective implementation of projects under two phases of AMRUT scheme

title: ‘We feel like we’ve been spared by divine grace,’ says Bengaluru tourist stranded in Kashmir after deadly terror attack
content: The Hindu spoke to stranded Karnataka tourists in Kashmir and the families of the victims killed in the terror attack

title: Pahalgam terror attack: The tale of two Jagdales: one killed by the terrorists, the other had miraculous escape
content: While one Santosh Jagdale visited the picturesque meadows at Jammu and Kashmir’s Pahalgam an hour before the terrorists struck at the place, the other was shot dead along with his relative

title: Government to hold all-party meet on Pahalgam attack on April 24
content: The move comes after the PM presided over a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security on April 23, upon cutting short his visit to Saudi Arabia

title: Union Health Ministry brings in new competency-based curricula for 10 allied and healthcare professions
content: India is skilling its healthcare professionals not just for India, but for the international market, says the Ministry; curricula of professions such as Physiotherapy, Optometry and Dialysis Therapy to see revision

title: Newly-wed Kanpur man among dead in Pahalgam terror attack, Yogi expresses condolences
content: Kanpur resident Shubham Dwivedi got married on Feb. 12; he, his wife, and ten others of his family were on a holiday trip to Jammu and Kashmir.

title: New AKG Centre building inaugurated
content: New AKG centre is the second building in the State to have a GRIHA-4 rating, endorsed by the Union Ministry of New and Renewable Energy

title: FKCCI calls for a quick reassessment of minimum wages to prevent closure of MSMEs
content: ‘The cost of doing business in Karnataka is now significantly higher than in neighbouring States like Tamil Nadu, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh’

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Indus treaty with Pakistan put on hold
content: Attari check post closed; Pakistan nationals told to return by May 1; Special visas deemed cancelled; diplomatic staff to be withdrawn

title: Karnataka government to bring back 40 stranded tourists on special flight
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah also announces ₹10 lakh compensation to the family of the victims

title: India emerging as key automobile and aviation hub: Union Minister
content: K. Rammohan Naidu says India’s aviation and auto sectors are booming, creating livelihood opportunities nationwide

title: Non-bailable warrant issued against Medha Patkar for failing to comply with court order
content: Court says she failed to comply with its order to submit probation bonds and deposit ₹1 lakh fine in a 24-year-old defamation case filed by Delhi Lieutenant Governor V.K. Saxena

title: Wild weather wreaks havoc at Thrissur zoo
content: Zoo has been witnessing heavy rush this vacation time. However, tragedy was averted as storm struck at night

title: Kerala boasts highest number of star hotels in country
content: Kerala has 94 five star, 420 four star and 601 three star hotels, well ahead of Maharashtra, Delhi and other States with metro cities

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Everyone sought his advice, say family of Indore victim lamenting loss
content: Sushil Nathaniel, the Indore resident who was slain during the Pahlgam terror attack, is survived by a wife and two children

title: Kuki houses set ablaze in Manipur’s Kamjong
content: The authorities of the Kamjong district bordering Myanmar imposed prohibitory orders around the affected villages

title: Acts of terror are a stain on society, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: History has shown that terrorism and violence have never achieved anything meaningful for the causes they seek to promote, he says, and calls for firm action against those responsible for the heinous act at Pahalgam in Jammu & Kashmir

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu gives the nod for constitution of 18-member council to oversee control of AIDS in Andhra Pradesh
content: It is aimed at strengthening the ongoing efforts to control HIV/AIDS, says Health Minister Satya Kumar

title: Pawan Kalyan to perform bhumi puja for 100-bed hospital in Pithapuram
content: The Dy CM will take time out to interact with locals at the Racha Banda programme and will distribute farm equipment

title: Tirupati police get hands-on training on emergency strike response
content: The department held the event to prepare their personnel in the know-how of dealing with attacks, keeping the situation under control and informing the higher-ups, before the arrival of special forces

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Terrorists asked name and religion of male tourists, shot them, says survivor
content: The tourist from Maharashtra said there were no security personnel around at the time of the attack, and an Army camp was located downhill

title: Joint Nilgiri tahr census from Thursday; grasslands, rocky terrain of ENP attract tahrs
content: Joint survey being taken up with Tamil Nadu from April 24 to 27 to mark the 50th anniversary of the establishment of Eravikulam National Park

title: Various organisations stage protests in Kittur Karnataka districts against terrror attack
content: They condemn the terror attack in Pahalgam of Jammu and Kashmir and seek strict action against the perpetrators

title: Tirupati to become sports hub of Rayalaseema, says Minister
content: Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy inaugurates statue of hockey legend and former Indian captain Dhyan Chand at the Srinivasa Sports Complex and launches the modernisation projects undertaken by SAAP at the complex

title: Congress seeks to forge a lasting pact with Anvar, but is undecided on the compact’s nature
content: The upcoming byelection in the Nilambur Assembly constituency imbued the conclave with an urgency to cobble together a political understanding with Mr Anvar.

title: Trinamool targets Union Home Minister over Pahalgam terrorist attack
content: The West Bengal ruling party also said that the Centre was directly responsible for this security lapse and the sham of ‘safe Kashmir’ has been exposed

title: 88 infant deaths, 8 maternal deaths reported in 2024-25 in West Godavari, probe initiated
content: District Collector Chadalavada Nagarani seeks accountability, health officer ordered to issue notices to government and private clinics where the deaths reported

title: In the aftermath of Pahalgam attack, grounded Dhruv helicopters resume flying in the Anantnag area
